business.headline: Thailand stock exchange halts trading after earthquake hits MyanmarFollowing tremors from the Myanmar earthquake, the Stock Exchange of Thailand suspended all trading for the Friday afternoon session.

DA hiked by 2%: How much salary will central government employees get?With the 2% hike, DA has now risen from 53% to 55%. Pensioners will also experience a similar increase in their Dearness Relief (DR).

Sensex, Nifty end FY25 on a weak note as Trump tariffs weigh on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 191.51 points to close at 77,414.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 72.60 points to end at 23,519.35.

Tracking India's billionaire boom over a decadeIndia's billionaire club isn't just growing—it's thriving. A decade ago, cracking this list was a rare feat. Now, it's happening faster than ever. Even with market swings and economic headwinds, the country keeps adding new names to its billionaire ranks.

Salary boost for central government employees, DA hiked by 2%With this revision, DA will rise from 53% to 55%, offering a salary boost to employees. The last DA increase took place in July 2024, when it was raised from 50% to 53%.
Missed TDS on rent? Here's what tax department is doingThe law requires tenants to deduct TDS at 2% on rent above Rs 50,000 per month, in case the landlord is a resident Indian.

India offers to lower US farm tariffs, looks to strengthen trade ties: ReportIndia-US trade talk: The government has proposed reducing import duties on several US agricultural products, including almonds, walnuts, cranberries, pistachios, and lentils.

Why is stock market falling today? 3 things investors need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 339.66 points to 77,266.77 at 1:13 pm and the NSE Nifty50 traded 100.45 points lower to trade at 23,491.50. Here are three important points retail investors need to know.

India's billionaires have wealth bigger than Saudi Arabia's GDP. Check detailsIndia's billionaires now have a combined wealth that exceeds the entire economy of Saudi Arabia. India ranks third globally in the number of billionaires, behind the United States and China.

Health insurance rejected? Here are 5 things you need to knowUnderstanding why health insurance claims are rejected is important as it will help you avoid unnecessary stress or financial burden during medical emergencies.

How this scheme can help you save Rs 20 lakh in 15 years for daughterIf you are planning for your daughter's higher education expenses, the Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) can be a great savings option.

Razorpay's Shashank Kumar, Harshil Mathur become India's youngest billionairesHarshil Mathur and Shashank Kumar met at IIT Roorkee, where they shared an interest in technology and problem-solving. Their journey into fintech began in 2014 when they launched Razorpay to simplify digital payments in India.
Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade over Trump tariff threats; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 282.59 points to 77,323.84, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 84.70 points to 23,507.25 as of 9:42 am.
Planning a bank transfer on March 31? Here's why it may not workWhile banks will remain open, transactions like fund transfers, cash deposits, and withdrawals may not go through.

Stocks to watch today: Infosys, Tata Motors, BEL, Adani Power, HCLTech and moreMarkets are set for a strong start on March 6 as key stocks like Infosys, Tata Motors, and Adani Power grab attention. Trade talks, global deals, and company moves could shape today's trading session. Here's what investors need to know.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will positive run continue on stock market?Stock market opening today: The Sensex and Nifty gained in the previous session amid reports of positive talks between Indian and US officials about a trade deal. Analysts have noted that the focus during today's trading session will be on upcoming tariff developments and the India-US trade deal outcome.
US suspends WTO financial contributions: ReportThe Trump administration has reportedly suspended financial contributions to The World Trade Organisation amid efforts to cut back government spending.
Wall Street drifts as auto tariffs hurt GM, help Tesla and othersDonald Trump's auto tariffs impacted Wall Street on Thursday morning, with autogiant General Motors falling by 6.8%.

Trump's 25% auto tariff: Which Indian companies will pay the priceUS President Donald Trump's 25% tariff on car imports will affect a few Indian companies, including Tata Motors, Eicher Motors, and Samvardhana Motherson. These firms ship components to the US and Europe's markets.

Sensex, Nifty close higher: Top gainers and losers, tariff impact and key driversStock market today: Some of the top gainers during today's session were Bajaj Finserv, IndusInd Bank, NTPC, L&T, Ultratech Cement, Hero MotoCorp, Adani Enterprises and BPCL. On the other hand, some of the top losers were Tata Motors, Sun Pharma, Eicher Motors, Apollo Hospitals, Bharti Airtel, Kotak Mahindra Bank and HCLTech.

entertainment.headline: Avengers Doomsday brings back X-Men favourites James Marsden, Ian McKellenAvengers: Doomsday brings back X-Men legends James Marsden, Ian McKellen, and more! Marvel fans can expect a nostalgic reunion as the MCU expands its multiverse.

Aditi Rao's AI-generated 'Bibbo Ghibli Jaan' is the cutest thing on the InternetActor Aditi Rao Hydari joined the growing list of celebrities experimenting with ChatGPT's new AI feature, which transforms images into Ghibli-style versions. She used it to give her Heeramandi character, Bibbojaan, a whimsical makeover, much to the delight of her fans.

Mohanlal plants a kiss on Prithviraj's mother at L2 Empuraan screening. WatchMohanlal recently attended the L2 Empuraan screening in Kerala. A viral video showed the veteran actor planting a kiss on Prithviraj Sukumaran's mother at the event.

Ananya Panday's reaction to 'Mr World Wide' Walker Blanco's post has fans talkingActor Ananya Panday has once again got the internet talking with her comment on rumoured boyfriend Walker Blanco's post. The two have reportedly been dating after Anant Ambani's Jamnagar bash.

Actor Shruti Haasan's Hyderabad live concert postponed. Here's whyActor Shruti Haasan was supposed to perform a live concert in Hyderabad on March 28. However, the event was postponed hours before the scheduled time.

Decoding Akshaye Khanna's secret to staying relevant in BollywoodDespite his absence from the public eye, actor Akshaye Khanna has managed to stay relevant through his iconic film choices and powerful performances. On his 50th birthday today, we take a look at his illustrious filmography and how he has redefined versatility and excellence in Indian cinema.

Salman Khan says 'Hindu-Muslim wasn't the issue' in parents' marriageSalman Khan revealed that the biggest hurdle in his parents' marriage wasn't religion but Salim Khan's career in Bollywood. Salim and Salma Khan got married in 1964.

Tamil actor Shruthi Narayanan reacts after alleged casting couch video leakTamil actor Shruthi Narayanan addressed the controversy after her alleged casting couch video surfaced online, urging people not to circulate it further. She described the situation as challenging for her family and herself, appealing for sensitivity and respect

Kartik Aaryan can't take his eyes off 'zindagi' Sreeleela in new picKartik Aaryan and Sreeleela shared a new romantic photo on social media. The image featured the two sitting in what seemed like a tea garden. The photo spoke volumes of their chemistry.

Actor Vikram takes auto to avoid crowd after meeting Sivakarthikeyan at screeningActor Vikram, fondly called Chiyaan by fans, attended the screening of his film, Veera Dheera Sooran's Part 2, in Chennai. After the screening, the actor left for his home in an auto to avoid the crowd at the theatre.

Shivaji Satam on CID's success: We seem like real heroes, we don't fly or jumpShivaji Satam talked about CID's animated version, the show's enduring legacy, and its return to TV. He reflected on its cult status, meme culture, and why it never glorified violence or crime.

Honey Bunny actor reacts after being mistaken for Tamil star Shruthi Narayanan'Citadel: Honey Bunny' actor Shruti Narayann has faced personal and professional challenges due to being mistaken for Tamil actor Shruthi Narayanan. The mix-up has led to harassment and work-related setbacks for Narayann.

Neha Kakkar's husband defends her after Melbourne concert backlashSinger Neha Kakkar defended herself after facing backlash in Melbourne, revealing organisers fled with funds. Husband Rohanpreet Singh supported her, urging people not to judge without knowing both sides.

Kartik Aaryan's Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri eyes Valentine's Day 2026Kartik Aaryan's upcoming film Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri is scheduled to hit theatres on Valentine's Day 2026. As per reports, Ananya Panday is set to star alongside Aaryan.

Sikandar advance booking: Salman's film beats Kisi Ka Bhai pre-sales before releaseSalman Khan's 'Sikandar' is heading for a good opening day at the box office. The film has grossed decent numbers in its advance booking so far with two more days to go for release.

Pics: Inside Ram Charan's 40th birthday bash hosted by wife Upasana KamineniRam Charan turned 40 years old on March 27. His wife, Upasana Kamineni, hosted a grand birthday bash for him, which was attended by actor Lakshmi Manchu, Mahesh Babu's wife, Namrata Shirodkar, and others.

Raid 2 teaser: It is Ajay Devgn vs Riteish Deshmukh in this gripping dramaAjay Devgn returns as IRS officer Amay Patnaik in Raid 2. The teaser hints at a high-stakes showdown with Riteish Deshmukh's character. Directed by Raj Kumar Gupta, the film releases on May 1.

Hrithik Roshan to turn director with Krrish 4, father Rakesh Roshan announces'Krrish 4', which is India's biggest superhero franchise, is now being directed by the 'superhero' himself, Hrithik Roshan. The film will be produced by YRF.

Ground Zero teaser: Emraan Hashmi leads a daring mission in intense war dramaEmraan Hashmi stars as BSF officer Narendra Nath Dubey in Ground Zero, inspired by real events. The teaser promises an intense war thriller, backed by Excel Entertainment, and also stars Sai Tamhankar.

general news.headline: Huge earthquake topples buildings in Myanmar, Thailand; several killed Live UpdatesMyanmar Earthquake News: Such was the impact of the earthquake that a high-rise collapsed in Bangkok, around 900 km away, killing two labourers and trapping over 40 others.

Cash row: Government approves Justice Varma's transfer to Allahabad High CourtFollowing the recovery of the cash pile from his residence during a fire incident last week, Justice Varma was repatriated from the Delhi High Court to the Allahabad High Court.

Vehicles torched as pro-monarchists clash with cops in Nepal, curfew in 3 areasPro-monarchy activists in Nepal clashed with police in Kathmandu on Friday as they demanded the restoration of the monarchy and Hindu Kingdom status.

Salary boost for central government employees, DA hiked by 2%With this revision, DA will rise from 53% to 55%, offering a salary boost to employees. The last DA increase took place in July 2024, when it was raised from 50% to 53%.

The lost grave of Dara Shikoh, murdered by brother AurangzebMughal emperor Aurangzeb got his brother Dara Shikoh beheaded in Delhi and presented his head to their father, Shah Jahan, whom he had imprisoned in Agra. Experts believe India's history would have been different had a scholarly and secular Dara become the emperor. Amid the controversy over Aurangzeb's grave, a look at the life of Dara, who translated the Upanishads into Persian, and the mystery around his tomb.

'Yashu Yashu' pastor Bajinder Singh found guilty in 2018 sexual harassment caseThe self-styled godman was arrested in connection to the same case in July 2018 at the Delhi airport while attempting to board a flight to London.

Service charge not mandatory, restaurants can't levy it: Delhi High CourtThe Delhi High Court ruled that service charges on food bills are voluntary and dismissed petitions challenging the CCPA's guidelines prohibiting mandatory imposition by hotels and restaurants.

Free speech can't be judged per standards of weak minds: Top court's big remarksThe Supreme Court's remarks came as it quashed an FIR filed against Congress MP Imran Pratapgarhi over a poem uploaded by him on social media. It holds importance in the backdrop of the Kunal Kamra row.

Tracking India's billionaire boom over a decadeIndia's billionaire club isn't just growing—it's thriving. A decade ago, cracking this list was a rare feat. Now, it's happening faster than ever. Even with market swings and economic headwinds, the country keeps adding new names to its billionaire ranks.

Vijay says 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly Election to be direct fight between DMK, TVKAt the TVK general body meeting, Vijay declared the 2026 Tamil Nadu elections as a direct fight between the TVK and DMK, attacking both Chief Minister MK Stalin and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Vijay accused DMK of corruption and the BJP of neglecting Tamil Nadu.

Video: Infinity pool turns waterfall as tremors jolt Bangkok after Myanmar quakeA video of the earthquake captured the impact, showing water spilling from rooftop pools of a high-rise building in Bangkok due to the intense shaking.

Tell everyone I killed her: Bengaluru techie phoned father after murdering wifeIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, Rajendra, father of the man who confessed to have killed his wife in Bengaluru, detailed his conversation with his son after the murder. Rajendra also revealed how the couple, first cousins, had frequent fights.
Are banks secretly charging you? List of hidden fees every Indian must knowThink your bank services are free? Think again, hidden fees could be draining your money.

Videos: Building collapses in Bangkok, bridge falls in Myanmar after major quakesTwo powerful earthquakes, measuring 7.7 and 6.4 in magnitude, hit Myanmar on Friday. The tremors were so strong that they were felt in Thailand's capital, Bangkok.
New MPV, SUV models can strengthen Nissan's position in India, but...Nissan aims to reach 1,00,000 units in both annual domestic sales and exports from India with the new and existing models.

MP Board Class 5th, 8th Result 2025 Declared: Direct link to check scorecardsThe Rajya Shiksha Kendra (RSK), Madhya Pradesh, has officially declared the MP Board Class 5 and Class 8 final exam results today, March 28, 2025, at 1 pm. Students who appeared for the 2024-25 academic session can now check their results on the official website – rskmp.in.

Hrithik Roshan to turn director with Krrish 4, father Rakesh Roshan announces'Krrish 4', which is India's biggest superhero franchise, is now being directed by the 'superhero' himself, Hrithik Roshan. The film will be produced by YRF.

Italian police shut down meth lab run by 'Breaking Bad' fanThe show chronicles the downward spiral of a high-school chemistry teacher who uses his knowledge to make and sell methamphetamine, also known as crystal meth.

Want to join politics? Be ready to spend Rs 3-4 lakh every monthA new study reveals extensive pre-election expenses, sale of nominations and growing vote-buying, creating an 'oligarchisation of democracy' where money determines power

Sensex, Nifty end FY25 on a weak note as Trump tariffs weigh on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 191.51 points to close at 77,414.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 72.60 points to end at 23,519.35.

Amid AI job threats, Bill Gates lists 3 professions that are safeMicrosoft founder Bill Gates has recently stated that while the AI job threat is real, there are a few careers that will not be affected. In an interview, he highlighted that energy professionals, biologists, and coders will be irreplaceable.
India reports eight outbreaks of bird flu in Andhra Pradesh: ReportIndia has reported eight outbreaks of highly pathogenic H5N1 bird flu in farms and backyard poultry in Andhra Pradesh.

India ready to help, authorities on standby: PM Modi on Myanmar, Thailand quakeExpressing concern over two back-to-back earthquakes of magnitudes 7.7 and 6.4 that struck Myanmar earlier today, PM Modi reached out to the Southeast Asian nation and Thailand, assuring assistance and offering prayers 'for the safety and well-being of everyone.'

Video: Massive fire at Greater Noida girls' hostel, students jump from balconyAn AC compressor blast sparked a huge fire at a girls' hostel in Greater Noida where two girls jumped from the second floor to save themselves.

sports.headline: NCAA Tournament: Cooper Flagg shines as Duke outlasts Arizona in sweet 16 thrillerCooper Flagg's epic buzzer-beater stuns Arizona, ignites March Madness chaos, and cements his rising stardom, fans erupt in shock, disbelief, and pure joy after witnessing the tournament's most electrifying moment yet.

New Zealand vs Pakistan ODI series: Squads, all you need to knowAfter losing the T20I series 1-4, Pakistan will face New Zealand in a three-match ODI series. Napier, Hamilton and  Mount Maunganui will host the matches in the series.

Just want to hit every ball: Ashutosh reveals mantra to power-hittingIPL 2025: Ashutosh Sharma spoke about his power-hitting skills after playing a match-winning knock of 66 for the Delhi Capitals in their match against Lucknow Super Giants.

Shardul Thakur going unsold in IPL 2025 auction still baffling: Robin UthappaRobin Uthappa said that he finds it baffling that Shardul Thakur went unsold during the IPL 2025 auction. Shardul was the star of the show with the ball as LSG defeated SRH on Thursday, March 27 in Hyderabad.

BCCI invites applications for spin bowling coach at Centre Of ExcellenceThe BCCI on Frdiay, March 23 announced that they are inviting applications for the role of spin bowling coach at the Centre Of Excellence in Bengaluru.

MS Dhoni looks to heal past wounds after 2024 heartbreakIPL 2025: MS Dhoni couldn't help Chennai Super Kings qualify for the playoffs after the five-time champions lost to Royal Challengers Bengaluru at the Chinnaswamy last year. Dhoni will be looking to make amends when the two teams meet on Friday at the Chepauk.

Handshake derby: CSK, RCB meet again after infamous Chinnaswamy encounterChennai Super Kings and Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) face off for the first time this season in the Indian Premier League. This marks the first meeting between the two teams since the infamous fixture at Chinnaswamy, where RCB fans heckled CSK supporters after qualifying for the playoffs last season.

Novak Djokovic sets all-time record, Eala's dream run ends in heartbreakMiami Open 2025: Novak Djokovic became the oldest to reach the semi-finals of an ATP Masters 1000 event after beating Sebastian Korda in straight sets. 19-year-old Alexandra Eala lost to Jessica Pegula in a three-set thriller.

Chennai's MS Dhoni fixation doesn't serve game well: Ambati Rayudu before CSK vs RCBAmbati Rayudu feels that the fixation the Chennai crowd have towards MS Dhoni isn't serving the game and the other CSK players well. Fans have been often chanting for Dhoni and hoping that a wicket falls so that the CSK star comes out to bat.

Are RCB over-reliant on Virat Kohli? CSK coach Stephen Fleming reactsChennai Super Kings coach Stephen Fleming has responded to the query about whether Royal Challengers Bengaluru are over-reliant on Virat Kohli ahead of the South Indian derby on Friday, March 28. Kohli has got a good record playing against CSK in the IPL.

SRH doesn't take any team lightly in IPL: Heinrich Klaasen comments after LSG lossHeinrich Klaasen has claimed that Sunrisers Hyderabad don't take any team lightly in the IPL after their loss to LSG on Thursday, March 27. Lucknow defeated Hyderabad by 5 wickets as the SRH's destructive batting was tied down in Hyderabad.

This marks the first meeting between the two teams since the infamous fixture at Chinnaswamy, where RCB fans heckled CSK supporters after qualifying for the playoffs last season.

Lucknow defeated Hyderabad by 5 wickets as the SRH's destructive batting was tied down in Hyderabad.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
